title: Reorganize navigation structure in mkdocs.yml
description:
**As a** documentation user
**I want** clear, intuitive navigation organized by product area and use case
**So that** I can quickly find information relevant to how I'm using Consoul (TUI, CLI, or SDK)

**Context:**
Current navigation in mkdocs.yml mixes concepts (User Guide, CLI Reference, Development) without clear product differentiation. Users need to know whether they're learning about the TUI interface, CLI commands, or SDK integration.

**Reference Analysis (.local repos):**

**AWS Copilot CLI** (.local/copilot-cli/mkdocs.yml:24-200):
```yaml
nav:
  - Home: index.en.md
  - Documentation:
    - Overview: docs/overview.en.md
    - Getting Started: [...]
    - Concepts: [Applications, Environments, Services, Jobs, Pipelines]
    - Commands: [Grouped by: Getting Started, Build, Release, Operate, Extend, Settings, All]
    - Developing: [Organized by feature]
  - Blogs: [...]
  - Community: [...]
```
**Key insights**: Commands organized by workflow phase, clear grouping

**MkDocs Material** (.local/mkdocs-material/mkdocs.yml:182-283):
```yaml
nav:
  - Home: index.md
  - Getting started: [Installation, Creating site, Publishing, Customization, ...]
  - Setup: [Color, Fonts, Language, Logo, Navigation, Search, Analytics, ...]
  - Plugins: [Blog, Group, Info, Meta, ...]
  - Reference: [Admonitions, Annotations, Buttons, Code blocks, Grids, ...]
  - Insiders: [...]
  - Community: [...]
  - Blog: [...]
```
**Key insights**: Setup vs Reference distinction, feature-focused organization

**Typer** (.local/typer/mkdocs.yml:71-150):
```yaml
nav:
  - Typer: index.md
  - features.md
  - Tutorial - User Guide:
      - tutorial/index.md
      - [Progressive depth: basics → advanced]
      - CLI Arguments: [Nested organization]
      - CLI Options: [Nested organization]
      - Commands, Parameters, SubCommands: [...]
  - Resources: [...]
  - About: [...]
  - release-notes.md
```
**Key insights**: Tutorial progression, logical nesting

**Current Consoul Navigation** (mkdocs.yml:171-196):
```yaml
nav:
  - Home: [Overview, Installation, Quick Start]
  - User Guide: [Getting Started, Configuration, Usage, CLI Chat, TUI (7 nested)]
  - CLI Reference: [Commands]
  - Development: [Setup, Contributing]
  - API Reference: [Overview]
```
**Problems:**
- No clear TUI vs CLI vs SDK separation
- "User Guide" is too broad
- Features scattered across sections
- No feature-focused navigation
- Missing SDK documentation landing

**Technical Notes:**
- Current: mkdocs.yml lines 171-196 (26 lines of nav)
- Need to create landing pages: docs/features/index.md, docs/sdk/index.md, docs/tui-guide/index.md
- Material for MkDocs supports navigation.tabs (already enabled)
- Use navigation.indexes for section overview pages
- Reference existing docs structure in docs/ directory

**Proposed Navigation Structure:**
```yaml
nav:
  - Home:
    - index.md
    - installation.md
    - quickstart.md
  
  - Getting Started:
    - TUI Mode: user-guide/tui.md  # Interactive terminal interface
    - CLI Chat: user-guide/cli-chat.md  # Command-line sessions
    - SDK Integration: sdk/index.md  # Python API usage
  
  - Features:
    - features/index.md  # Feature overview
    - Tool Calling: 
      - tools.md  # Complete tool reference
      - Security: SECURITY.md
    - Code Search:
      - user-guide/code-search.md
      - user-guide/code-search-troubleshooting.md
    - Image Analysis: user-guide/image-analysis.md
    - File Editing: user-guide/file-editing.md
  
  - TUI Guide:
    - user-guide/tui/interface.md
    - user-guide/tui/features.md
    - user-guide/tui/keyboard-shortcuts.md
    - user-guide/tui/modals.md
    - user-guide/tui/themes.md
    - user-guide/tui/configuration.md
  
  - Reference:
    - CLI Commands: cli-reference/index.md
    - Configuration: user-guide/configuration.md
    - API Documentation: api/index.md
  
  - Advanced:
    - SDK Integration: sdk/tool-calling-integration.md
    - SearXNG Setup: advanced/searxng-setup.md
    - Contributing: contributing.md
    - Development: development.md
```

**Files to Create:**
- docs/features/index.md - Feature overview landing page
- docs/sdk/index.md - SDK documentation landing page  
- docs/tui-guide/index.md (optional) - Could use user-guide/tui.md

**Files to Modify:**
- mkdocs.yml - Complete nav restructure (lines 171-196)

**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Given** I visit the documentation
**When** I view the top navigation tabs
**Then** I see clear sections: Home, Getting Started, Features, TUI Guide, Reference, Advanced

**Given** I'm learning to use Consoul for the first time
**When** I click "Getting Started"
**Then** I see three clear paths: TUI Mode, CLI Chat, SDK Integration

**Given** I want to learn about a specific feature
**When** I click "Features"
**Then** I see: Tool Calling, Code Search, Image Analysis, File Editing with descriptions

**Given** I'm using the TUI
**When** I click "TUI Guide"
**Then** I see comprehensive TUI documentation: Interface, Features, Shortcuts, Modals, Themes, Config

**Given** I need command reference
**When** I click "Reference"
**Then** I see: CLI Commands, Configuration, API Documentation

**Given** I'm on mobile
**When** I view navigation
**Then** tabs collapse into hamburger menu and all sections are accessible

**Testing Considerations:**
- Test all navigation links work (no 404s)
- Verify breadcrumb navigation
- Test mobile hamburger menu
- Ensure search still finds all pages
- Check navigation.tabs rendering
- Verify navigation.indexes show section overviews

**Implementation Hints:**
1. Create landing pages first (features/index.md, sdk/index.md)
2. Update mkdocs.yml nav section
3. Use navigation.indexes to show overview on section click
4. Reference .local repos for nesting patterns
5. Test with `mkdocs serve` after each change
6. Use clear section descriptions in landing pages

**Navigation Best Practices from Research:**
- Use verb-based sections (Getting Started, Reference) or noun-based (Features, Tools)
- Group by user intent (learn, use, develop)
- Progressive disclosure (overview → details)
- Clear landing pages for each major section
- Nested structure max 3 levels deep
- Index pages for navigation.indexes feature

**Story Points:** 5
**Labels:** documentation, task, navigation, ux-improvement

**Dependencies:**
- SOUL-177 (Feature landing pages) - Should be created concurrently
- SOUL-174 (Homepage redesign) - Homepage should link to new structure

**References:**
- .local/copilot-cli/mkdocs.yml (workflow-based organization)
- .local/mkdocs-material/mkdocs.yml (setup vs reference pattern)
- .local/typer/mkdocs.yml (progressive tutorial structure)
